alert.note: Alert for Creek; Nowata; Okfuskee; Okmulgee; Osage; Pawnee; Rogers; Tulsa; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 05 at 2:39PM CST until March 05 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: .A dry line will move into portions of northeast Oklahoma through the afternoon, possibly as far east as a Nowata to Okemah line by early this evening. Rapidly falling humidity, very warm temperatures and gusty west to southwest winds will develop behind the dryline which will result in quickly deteriorating fire weather conditions. A cold front will move through northeast Oklahoma this evening and while cooler temperatures will result, an abrupt shift to northwest winds will complicate ongoing fire suppression efforts. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR VERY DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS FOR OSAGE AND PAWNEE COUNTIES... * AFFECTED AREA...IN Oklahoma, Osage, and Pawnee counties. * WIND...Gusty west to southwest wind at 25 to 40 mph. * HUMIDITY...Afternoon RH values falling into the 15 to 25 percent range. * TEMPERATURE...Unseasonably warm conditions with highs around 80 degrees. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that a dangerous combination of weather conditions and dry vegetation is expected within 24 hours, favoring rapid growth and spread of any wildfires. The primary weather factors include stronger winds, lower humidities, and warmer temperatures.

area.areaDesc: Creek; Nowata; Okfuskee; Okmulgee; Osage; Pawnee; Rogers; Tulsa; Washington
